article:
In computer and telecommunications networks, 'presence information' is a status
indicator that conveys ability and willingness of a potential communication
partnerâfor example a user--to communicate. A user's client provides presence
information (presence state) via a network connection to a presence service,
which is stored in what constitutes his personal availability record (called a
presentity) and can be made available for distribution to other users (called
watchers) to convey his availability for communication. Presence information has
wide application in many communication services and is one of the innovations
driving the popularity of instant messaging or recent implementations of voice
over IP clients.
headings: Presence information in the business community
